author: John D. McKinnon
title: Commerce Department Weighs Alternative Penalties for China’s ZTE
text:
WASHINGTON—Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross said Monday that he is considering alternative punishments for ZTE Corp., potentially opening the door to a reprieve for the imperiled Chinese telecommunications giant.
The move comes a day after President Donald Trump said he was working with Chinese President Xi Jinping to keep ZTE alive. The firm has been badly hurt by recent Commerce Department penalties relating to its past dealings with North Korea and Iran that have cut off ZTE from its U.S. suppliers.
... RELATED VIDEO “Made in China 2025” is Beijing’s industrial plan to dominate high-tech industries including robotics, aerospace and computer chips. The Trump administration argues China is using the plan to give its tech companies unfair advantage over foreign rivals. But what is it exactly?
